body:
# wgsim.cr

[![build](https://github.com/kojix2/wgsim.cr/actions/workflows/build.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/kojix2/wgsim.cr/actions/workflows/build.yml)

Trying to re-implement and add functionality to [wgsim](https://github.com/lh3/wgsim) in Crystal.

:black_cat: Please note that this project has been created for personal learning and experimental purposes and is not intended for practical use.

## Installation

[GitHub Releases](https://github.com/kojix2/wgsim.cr/releases/latest)

From source:

```sh
git clone https://github.com/kojix2/wgsim.cr
cd wgsim.cr
shards build --release -Dpreview_mt src/wgsim.cr
```

## Usage

```
  Program: wgsim (Crystal implementation of wgsim)
  Version: 0.0.1.alpha
    mut          mutate the reference
    seq          generate the reads
    version      show version number
```

```
  Usage: wgsim mut [options] <in.ref.fa>

    -r FLOAT     rate of mutations [0.001]
    -R FLOAT     fraction of indels [0.15]
    -X FLOAT     probability an indel is extended [0.3]
    -S UINT64    seed for random generator
    -t INT       Number of threads [4]
    --help       show this help message
```

```
  Usage: wgsim seq [options] <in.ref.fa> <out.read1.fq> <out.read2.fq>

    -e FLOAT     base error rate [0.02]
    -d INT       outer distance between the two ends [500]
    -s INT       standard deviation [50]
    -D FLOAT     average sequencing depth [10.0]
    -1 INT       length of the first read [70]
    -2 INT       length of the second read [70]
    -A FLOAT     Discard reads over FLOAT% ambiguous bases [0.05]
    -S UINT64    seed for random generator
    -t INT       Number of threads [4]
    --help       show this help message
```

## NOTE

- The tool provides two simulation classes: `MutationSimulator` and `SequenceSimulator`. (You may also want to add a `SelectionSimulator`.)
- The key point is to include the complete DNA sequence of the cell's genome in the Fasta file. In the case of diploid cells, two Fasta records should be added for each pair of homologous chromosomes. When there is an increase in chromosome copy number due to extrachromosomal DNA, additional records must be included in the Fasta file to reflect this amplification. If a chromosome undergoes inversion or fusion, the Fasta file should contain a record that accurately represents these changes. This means that the genome should not be represented in any compressed form on the computer. Consequently, there will be as many `UInt8` or `RefBase` structures as there are nucleotides. While this approach may reduce processing speed and increase disk and memory usage, it helps to avoid many complications.
- [wgsimのコードを眺める [JA]](https://qiita.com/kojix2/items/35318fbefe0e2ea9fca1)

## Development

Dependencies:

- [kojix2/nworkers.cr](https://github.com/kojix2/nworkers.cr) - Set the number of worker threads at runtime.
- [kojix2/randn.cr](https://github.com/kojix2/randn.cr) - Normal random number generator.
- [kojix2/fastx.cr](https://github.com/kojix2/fastx.cr) - Fasta file reader.
  
## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/kojix2/wgsim/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

def.name: run
def.body:
begin
  case action
  when Action::Mutate
    Mutate.run(mopt)
  when Action::Sequence
    Sequence.run(sopt)
  when Action::Version
    print_version
  when Action::Help
    print_help
  else
    raise(ArgumentError.new("Invalid action: #{action || "nil"}"))
  end
rescue ex
  print_error(ex)
  exit(1)
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (substitution_rate : Float64, insertion_rate : Float64, deletion_rate : Float64, insertion_extension_probability : Float64, deletion_extension_probability : Float64, seed : UInt64 | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (substitution_rate : Float64, insertion_rate : Float64, deletion_rate : Float64, insertion_extension_probability : Float64, deletion_extension_probability : Float64, seed : UInt64 | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(substitution_rate, insertion_rate, deletion_rate, insertion_extension_probability, deletion_extension_probability, seed)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: generate_insertion
instance_methods.doc: Generate insertion based on given size and indel extension probability
instance_methods.summary: Generate insertion based on given size and indel extension probability

def.name: generate_insertion
def.body:
size = 1
while rand <= insertion_extension_probability
  size = size + 1
end
Slice(UInt8).new(size) do
  ACGT[rand(4)]
end

def.name: insert_nucleotide
def.body:
ins = generate_insertion
log_insertion(n, ins)
RefBase.new(nucleotide: n, mutation_type: MutType::INSERT, insertion: ins)

def.name: log_deletion
def.body:
delseq = @deletions.map do |n|
  n.chr
end.join
STDERR.puts(["[wgsim]", "DEL", @name, @index - @deletions.size, delseq, "."].join("\t"))

def.name: perform_substitution
def.body:
case nucleotide
when 65_u8
  CGT[rand(3)]
when 67_u8
  AGT[rand(3)]
when 71_u8
  ACT[rand(3)]
when 84_u8
  ACG[rand(3)]
else
  78_u8
end

def.name: simulate_mutations
def.body:
@name = name
sequence.map do |n|
  @index = @index + 1
  if previous_ref_base_is_deletion?
    if extend_deletion?
      base = delete_nucleotide(n)
      next base
    else
      log_deletion
      @deletions.clear
    end
  end
  if n == 78_u8
    next nochange_nucleotide(n)
  end
  case rand
  when ..substitution_rate
    substitute_nucleotide(n)
  when ..(substitution_rate + insertion_rate)
    insert_nucleotide(n)
  when ..((substitution_rate + insertion_rate) + deletion_rate)
    delete_nucleotide(n)
  else
    nochange_nucleotide(n)
  end
end

def.name: substitute_nucleotide
def.body:
nn = perform_substitution(n)
log_substitution(n, nn)
RefBase.new(nucleotide: nn, mutation_type: MutType::SUBSTITUTE)

def.name: summary

instance_methods.name: parse
instance_methods.doc: Parses the passed *args* (defaults to `ARGV`), running the handlers associated to each option.
instance_methods.summary: Parses the passed args (defaults to ARGV), running the handlers associated to each option.
instance_methods.args_string: (argv = ARGV) : Tuple(Action | Nil, Mutate::Option | Sequence::Option | Nil)

def.name: parse
def.body:
super(argv)
case action
when Action::Mutate
  mopt.reference = Path.new(argv.shift)
  {action, mopt}
when Action::Sequence
  sopt.reference = Path.new(argv.shift)
  sopt.output1 = Path.new(argv.shift)
  sopt.output2 = Path.new(argv.shift)
  {action, sopt}
else
  {action, nil}
end

def.name: _on_debug_
def.body:
on("--debug", "Show backtrace on error") do
        CLI.debug = true
      
end

def.name: _on_help_
def.body:
on("-h", "--help", "Show this help") do
        @action = Action::Help
      
end

      
# Crystal's OptionParser returns to its initial state after parsing

      
# by `with_preserved_state`. This also initialises @flags.

      
# @help_message is needed to store subcommand messages.

      @help_message = self.to_s

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (nucleotide : UInt8, mutation_type : Wgsim::MutType, insertion : Slice(UInt8) | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (nucleotide : UInt8, mutation_type : Wgsim::MutType, insertion : Slice(UInt8) | Nil = nil)

def.name: run
def.body:
output_fasta_1 = File.open(output1, "w")
output_fasta_2 = File.open(output2, "w")
names = [] of String
channel = Channel(String).new
Fastx::Fasta::Reader.open(reference) do |reader|
  reader.each do |name, sequence|
    names << name
    normalized_sequence = Fastx.normalize_sequence(sequence)
    spawn do
      core.run(name, normalized_sequence) do |record1, record2|
        output_fasta_1.puts(record1)
        output_fasta_2.puts(record2)
      end
      channel.send(name)
    end
  end
end
while names.present?
  name = channel.receive
  names.delete(name)
  STDERR.puts("[wgsim] #{name} done")
end
output_fasta_1.close
output_fasta_2.close

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (average_depth : Float64, distance : Int32, std_deviation : Int32, size_left : Int32, size_right : Int32, error_rate : Float64, max_ambiguous_ratio : Float64, seed : UInt64 | Nil = nil)
constructors.args_html: (average_depth : Float64, distance : Int32, std_deviation : Int32, size_left : Int32, size_right : Int32, error_rate : Float64, max_ambiguous_ratio : Float64, seed : UInt64 | Nil = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(average_depth, distance, std_deviation, size_left, size_right, error_rate, max_ambiguous_ratio, seed)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: fasta_record
instance_methods.args_string: (name, pair_index, position, insert_size, read_index, sequence : Slice(UInt8)) : String
instance_methods.args_html: (name, pair_index, position, insert_size, read_index, sequence : Slice(UInt8)) : String

def.name: fasta_record
def.body:
sequence = String.new(sequence)
String.build do |str|
  (str << ">#{name}_#{position}_#{insert_size}:#{pair_index}/#{read_index + 1}") << "\n"
  (str << sequence) << "\n"
  (str << "+") << "\n"
  (str << ("2" * [size_left, size_right][read_index])) << "\n"
end

def.name: generate_pair_sequence
def.body:
if flip
  read1 = target_seq[position...(position + size_left)]
  read2 = reverse_complement(target_seq[((position + insert_size) - size_right)...(position + insert_size)])
else
  read1 = reverse_complement(target_seq[((position + insert_size) - size_left)...(position + insert_size)])
  read2 = target_seq[position...(position + size_right)]
end
{read1, read2}

def.name: generate_sequencing_error
def.body:
valid_nucleotides = [65_u8, 67_u8, 71_u8, 84_u8]
sequence.map do |b|
  case b
  when 78_u8
    b
  when 65_u8, 67_u8, 71_u8, 84_u8
    if rand < error_rate
      other_nucleotides = valid_nucleotides - [b]
      other_nucleotides[rand(3)]
    else
      b
    end
  else
    raise("Invalid nucleotide: #{b}")
  end
end

def.name: reverse_complement
def.body:
complements = {65_u8 => 84_u8, 67_u8 => 71_u8, 71_u8 => 67_u8, 84_u8 => 65_u8, 78_u8 => 78_u8}
sequence.map do |b|
  complements.fetch(b) do
    raise("Invalid nucleotide: #{b}")
  end
end.reverse!

def.name: run
def.body:
contig_length = sequence.size
n_pairs = ((contig_length * average_depth) / (size_left + size_right)).to_i
pair_index = 0
while pair_index < n_pairs
  ((pair_index % (10 ** ((Math.log10(n_pairs)).to_i - 1))) == 0) && (puts("[wgsim] #{name} #{pair_index}/#{n_pairs}"))
  insert_size = random_insert_size
  position = random_position(contig_length, insert_size)
  ((position < 0 || position > contig_length) || ((position + insert_size) - 1) < contig_length) || (raise("Invalid position or insert size: position=#{position}, insert_size=#{insert_size}, contig_length=#{contig_length}"))
  flip = next_bool
  read1_sequence, read2_sequence = generate_pair_sequence(sequence, position, insert_size, flip)
  if ((read1_sequence.count('N')) / read1_sequence.size) > max_ambiguous_ratio || ((read2_sequence.count('N')) / read2_sequence.size) > max_ambiguous_ratio
    next
  end
  read1_sequence = generate_sequencing_error(read1_sequence)
  read2_sequence = generate_sequencing_error(read2_sequence)
  yield(fasta_record(name.split[0], pair_index, position, insert_size, 0, read1_sequence), fasta_record(name.split[0], pair_index, position, insert_size, 1, read2_sequence))
  pair_index = pair_index + 1
end
